intro: Sonchus taquetii, commonly known as the Taquet's sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators. Sonchus taquetii is often found in disturbed soils and can be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
